intro: Chorizanthe, commonly known as desert flax, is a genus of flowering plants in the Amaranthaceae family. These plants are native to North America, particularly the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. They are characterized by their upright growth habit, hairy stems, and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. Chorizanthe species are typically drought-tolerant and thrive in arid or semi-arid environments. Their seeds are often used by birds and small mammals, contributing to their ecological importance in desert ecosystems.
